name: Blowfish
description: Blowfish is a symmetric-key block cipher designed by Bruce Schneier in 1993. It is notable for its fast encryption speed and variable key length from 32 to 448 bits, making it suitable for applications where key changes are infrequent.

securityNotes.message: Blowfish has a 64-bit block size which may be vulnerable to birthday attacks with large amounts of data
Blowfish is suitable for applications where key changes are infrequent due to expensive key setup
No effective cryptanalysis of Blowfish has been found to date

technicalDetails.keySchedule: Key-dependent S-boxes and subkeys derived from the key
technicalDetails.subkeys: 18 32-bit subkeys derived from the original key

useCases: Applications requiring fast encryption with infrequent key changes
Embedded systems with limited computational resources
limitations: 64-bit block size limits security with large data volumes
Not suitable for applications requiring frequent key changes
Superseded by newer algorithms like AES for most applications
